intro: Lepidagathis nickeriensis, commonly known as the Nickerie lepidagathis, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems, typical of many species in its family. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
